input: Write a professional email declining a meeting invitation due to a scheduling conflict
expected_output:
Subject: Unable to Attend - Meeting on [Date]

Hi [Name],

Thank you for the invitation. Unfortunately, I have a prior commitment at that time and won't be able to attend.

Could you please share the meeting notes afterward? I'd also be happy to provide any input in advance if helpful.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email to a client apologizing for a delayed shipment
expected_output:
Subject: Update on Your Order #[Number] - Shipment Delay

Dear [Client Name],

I sincerely apologize for the delay in shipping your order. Due to unexpected supply chain issues, your delivery has been pushed back by approximately 3 business days.

Your revised estimated delivery date is [Date]. As a gesture of goodwill, we've upgraded your shipping to express at no additional cost.

Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email requesting time off for two weeks
expected_output:
Subject: Time Off Request - [Start Date] to [End Date]

Hi [Manager Name],

I'd like to request two weeks of paid time off from [Start Date] to [End Date]. I will ensure all current projects are up to date before my departure and will arrange coverage with [Colleague Name].

Please let me know if these dates work or if you'd like to discuss alternatives.

Thank you,
[Your Name]

input: Write a follow-up email after a job interview
expected_output:
Subject: Thank You - [Position] Interview

Dear [Interviewer Name],

Thank you for taking the time to meet with me today. I enjoyed learning more about the [Position] role and the team's work on [specific project discussed].

Our conversation reinforced my enthusiasm for the opportunity, and I believe my experience in [relevant skill] would be a strong fit for your needs.

Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need any additional information. I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email introducing a new team member to the department
expected_output:
Subject: Welcome [New Member Name] to the Team!

Hi everyone,

I'm excited to introduce [New Member Name], who is joining us as [Title] starting [Date]. [They] bring [X years] of experience in [relevant field] and will be working on [project/area].

Please join me in welcoming [them] to the team. [New Member Name], feel free to reach out to anyone — we're a friendly bunch!

Best,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email requesting a project deadline extension
expected_output:
Subject: Request for Deadline Extension - [Project Name]

Hi [Recipient Name],

I'm writing to request a one-week extension for the [Project Name] deadline, from [Original Date] to [New Date].

We encountered [specific issue] that has impacted our timeline. The additional week will allow us to deliver the quality we committed to. All other milestones remain on track.

I'm happy to discuss this further if needed.

Thank you for your understanding,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email to a vendor negotiating a lower price
expected_output:
Subject: Pricing Discussion - [Product/Service]

Dear [Vendor Name],

Thank you for the quote on [Product/Service]. While we're impressed with your offering, the pricing is above our current budget.

Given our intention to place a recurring order of [volume], would you be able to offer a volume discount or adjusted rate? We value this partnership and hope to find a mutually beneficial arrangement.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email announcing a company policy change about remote work
expected_output:
Subject: Updated Remote Work Policy - Effective [Date]

Hi team,

I'm writing to share an update to our remote work policy, effective [Date].

Key changes:
- Employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week
- Core in-office days are Tuesday and Thursday
- Remote work requests should be submitted via [System] by Friday of the prior week

This change reflects our commitment to flexibility while maintaining collaboration. Please review the full policy on [Link] and reach out to HR with any questions.

Best,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email to a customer explaining a billing error and the correction made
expected_output:
Subject: Billing Correction - Invoice #[Number]

Dear [Customer Name],

We identified an error on your recent invoice #[Number] where you were charged [incorrect amount] instead of [correct amount]. We sincerely apologize for this mistake.

A corrected invoice is attached, and a refund of [difference] has been processed to your account. Please allow 3-5 business days for it to appear.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email scheduling a quarterly business review meeting
expected_output:
Subject: Q[X] Business Review - Meeting Invite

Hi [Name],

I'd like to schedule our quarterly business review for [proposed date and time]. The meeting will cover:

- Q[X] performance summary
- Key metrics and KPIs
- Upcoming initiatives for Q[X+1]
- Open discussion

Please confirm your availability or suggest an alternative time. I'll send a calendar invite and agenda once confirmed.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email responding to a customer complaint about product quality
expected_output:
Subject: Re: Product Quality Concern - Order #[Number]

Dear [Customer Name],

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I'm sorry to hear that the product didn't meet your expectations.

We take quality very seriously and would like to make this right. We can offer you:
1. A full replacement shipped within 24 hours
2. A complete refund to your original payment method

Please let us know your preference, and we'll process it immediately. We've also shared your feedback with our quality team to prevent this from happening again.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email to a colleague asking for help with a presentation
expected_output:
Subject: Quick Favor - Presentation for [Meeting/Event]

Hi [Name],

I'm preparing a presentation for [meeting/event] on [date] and could use your expertise on the [specific section] portion.

Would you have 30 minutes this week to review my slides and share your input? I've attached the current draft for context.

No worries if you're too busy — I know it's a hectic time. Just thought your insights would really strengthen it.

Thanks,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email notifying customers of a system maintenance window
expected_output:
Subject: Scheduled Maintenance - [Date], [Time] [Timezone]

Dear Valued Customers,

We will be performing scheduled maintenance on [Date] from [Start Time] to [End Time] [Timezone]. During this window, [Service Name] may be temporarily unavailable.

What to expect:
- Estimated downtime: [duration]
- Affected services: [list]
- No action required on your end

We've scheduled this during off-peak hours to minimize disruption. If you have questions, please contact support at [email/phone].

Thank you for your patience,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email congratulating a team on completing a major project
expected_output:
Subject: Congratulations Team - [Project Name] Launch!

Hi team,

I want to take a moment to congratulate everyone on the successful launch of [Project Name]! This was a complex effort that required exceptional collaboration, creativity, and dedication.

Special recognition to [names/teams] for going above and beyond during the final sprint. The results speak for themselves: [specific achievement or metric].

I'm proud to work with such a talented group. Enjoy the well-deserved celebration!

Cheers,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email asking for a referral from a former colleague
expected_output:
Subject: Quick Request - Referral for [Position] at [Company]

Hi [Name],

I hope you're doing well! I saw that [Company] is hiring for a [Position] role, and I noticed you're connected with their team.

Would you be comfortable referring me? I believe my experience in [relevant area] aligns well with what they're looking for. I've attached my updated resume for reference.

Completely understand if it's not a good fit — I appreciate you considering it either way.

Best,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email to IT requesting new software access
expected_output:
Subject: Software Access Request - [Software Name]

Hi IT Team,

I'm requesting access to [Software Name] for my role as [Title] in the [Department] department.

Details:
- Software: [Name and version]
- Reason: [Brief justification]
- Approved by: [Manager Name]
- Urgency: [Standard/High]

Please let me know if you need any additional information or approvals to process this request.

Thank you,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email informing a partner about a change in project scope
expected_output:
Subject: Project Scope Update - [Project Name]

Hi [Partner Name],

I wanted to inform you of a scope change for [Project Name] that was agreed upon in our last steering committee meeting.

Changes:
- Added: [new deliverable or feature]
- Removed: [removed item]
- Timeline impact: [none / extended by X days]
- Budget impact: [none / increase of $X]

The updated project plan is attached. I'd like to schedule a brief call this week to walk through the changes together.

Please let me know your availability.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

input: Write a cold outreach email to a potential business partner
expected_output:
Subject: Partnership Opportunity - [Your Company] x [Their Company]

Hi [Name],

I'm [Your Name] from [Your Company]. I've been following [Their Company]'s work in [area] and believe there's a strong opportunity for collaboration.

Specifically, I think we could [brief value proposition]. Our [product/service] has helped companies like [example] achieve [result].

Would you be open to a 15-minute call next week to explore this? I'm flexible on timing.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Title] | [Company]
[Phone]

input: Write an email updating stakeholders on project progress
expected_output:
Subject: [Project Name] - Weekly Status Update (Week of [Date])

Hi all,

Here's the weekly update for [Project Name]:

Status: On Track / At Risk / Delayed

Completed this week:
- [Item 1]
- [Item 2]

Planned for next week:
- [Item 1]
- [Item 2]

Blockers/Risks:
- [Blocker, if any, with mitigation plan]

Key Metrics:
- [Metric]: [Value]

Please reach out with any questions. Next update: [Date].

Best,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email to a recruiter expressing interest in a position
expected_output:
Subject: Interest in [Position] Role - [Job ID if applicable]

Dear [Recruiter Name],

I'm writing to express my interest in the [Position] role at [Company]. With [X years] of experience in [relevant field] and a proven track record in [key skill], I'm confident I'd be a strong fit for this opportunity.

I'm particularly drawn to [specific aspect of the role or company]. My resume is attached for your review.

I'd welcome the chance to discuss how my background aligns with your team's needs. I'm available for a call at your convenience.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Phone] | [LinkedIn]

input: Write an email to a team lead proposing a new workflow process
expected_output:
Subject: Proposal: Improved Workflow for [Process Name]

Hi [Name],

I've been thinking about how we can streamline our [process name] workflow and wanted to share a proposal.

Current pain points:
- [Issue 1]
- [Issue 2]

Proposed changes:
- [Change 1]: [Expected benefit]
- [Change 2]: [Expected benefit]

Estimated impact: [time saved / quality improvement / cost reduction]

I'd love to discuss this in our next 1:1 or set up a quick meeting. Happy to put together a more detailed plan if you think it's worth pursuing.

Thanks,
[Your Name]

input: Write a resignation email
expected_output:
Subject: Resignation - [Your Name]

Dear [Manager Name],

I'm writing to formally resign from my position as [Title], effective [Last Day, typically 2 weeks out].

I've truly valued my time at [Company] and the opportunities for growth I've had here. I'm committed to ensuring a smooth transition and am happy to help train my replacement or document my current projects during the notice period.

Thank you for your support and leadership. I wish the team continued success.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

input: Write an email requesting feedback on a document draft
expected_output:
Subject: Review Request - [Document Name] Draft

Hi [Name],

I've completed a draft of [Document Name] and would appreciate your review. The document covers [brief description].

I'm particularly looking for feedback on:
- [Specific area 1]
- [Specific area 2]
- Any gaps or inaccuracies

The draft is attached. Could you share your feedback by [date]? That gives us time to incorporate changes before the [deadline/meeting].

Thank you in advance!

[Your Name]

input: Write an email to a supplier requesting a product sample
expected_output:
Subject: Sample Request - [Product Name]

Dear [Supplier Name],

We're interested in [Product Name] for a potential bulk order and would like to request a sample for evaluation.

Details:
- Product: [Name/SKU]
- Quantity needed for evaluation: [number]
- Shipping address: [Address]

We'd also appreciate any spec sheets, certifications, or pricing information for orders of [volume].

Please let us know the lead time and any costs associated with the sample.

Thank you,
[Your Name]
[Company]

input: Write an email thanking a speaker after a company event
expected_output:
Subject: Thank You for Your Presentation!

Dear [Speaker Name],

On behalf of [Company/Team], thank you for your excellent presentation on [topic] at our [event name] yesterday.

The feedback from attendees has been overwhelmingly positive. Your insights on [specific topic] were particularly valuable and sparked great discussion among the team.

We'd love to share your slides with attendees who couldn't make it, if you're comfortable with that. And we'd certainly welcome you back for future events.

Thank you again for your time and expertise.

Warm regards,
[Your Name]

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email declining a meeting invitation
bad_output: nah cant make it. busy that day lol
reason_why_bad: Too informal, uses slang, no greeting or sign-off, provides no alternative or follow-up, unprofessional tone

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write a follow-up email after a job interview
bad_output: Hey, just checking if you've made a decision yet? I really need this job. Please let me know ASAP.
reason_why_bad: Sounds desperate, too casual, pressures the recipient, no reference to specific interview details, lacks professionalism

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to a client apologizing for a delayed shipment
bad_output: Sorry about the delay. It happens sometimes. Your stuff should arrive eventually.
reason_why_bad: Dismissive tone, no specific details about the delay or resolution, no timeline given, lacks empathy and professionalism

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email requesting time off
bad_output: I won't be in next week. Thanks.
reason_why_bad: No subject line format, no specific dates, no mention of coverage plan, too abrupt, doesn't ask for approval

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to a vendor negotiating a lower price
bad_output: Your prices are too high. We can get it cheaper elsewhere. Lower your price or we'll go to your competitor.
reason_why_bad: Aggressive and threatening tone, no specific ask, burns relationship, unprofessional negotiation tactic, no mention of mutual benefit

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email announcing a policy change
bad_output: New policy: everyone must be in the office 5 days a week starting Monday. No exceptions.
reason_why_bad: No context or rationale provided, no transition period, authoritarian tone, no channel for questions, no subject line structure

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

reason_why_bad: Self-centered pitch, no research about recipient, no value proposition for them, assumes sale, no specific ask or call to action

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write a resignation email

reason_why_bad: Hostile and unprofessional, burns bridges, no notice period, no transition plan, emotionally charged

reason_why_bad: Blames the customer, dismissive, no empathy, no offer to help, condescending tone, will lose the customer

reason_why_bad: Backhanded compliment, undermines the achievement, no specific praise, no recognition of individuals, demotivating tone

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to IT requesting software access
bad_output: I need access to the software NOW. This is urgent and I've been waiting too long. Please prioritize.
reason_why_bad: Demanding tone, no specific details about which software, no justification, no approval information, creates conflict

bad_output: Hey can you do the data analysis section of my presentation? I don't have time. Thanks.
reason_why_bad: Delegates their own work without asking, no context about the presentation, no offer of reciprocity, assumes compliance

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

bad_output: Things are going fine. We should finish sometime soon. No major problems.
reason_why_bad: No specific details or metrics, no timeline, no completed/upcoming items, no structure, uninformative and vague

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

bad_output: Let's meet sometime this week or next to go over stuff. When are you free?
reason_why_bad: No specific date/time proposed, no agenda, vague purpose ('stuff'), no structure, wastes recipient's time

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

bad_output: FYI we have a new person starting. Their name is John.
reason_why_bad: Minimal effort, no role/background info, no welcome sentiment, no encouragement to connect, impersonal

reason_why_bad: No specific role mentioned, no explanation of fit, no enthusiasm, demanding tone ('call me'), no professional sign-off

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

reason_why_bad: No specific new date proposed, no explanation of why, no mention of what's been completed, no impact assessment, vague

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email thanking a speaker after an event
bad_output: Thanks for coming to speak. It was good.
reason_why_bad: Generic and minimal, no specific reference to content, no mention of audience reaction, no follow-up offer, forgettable

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email explaining a billing error to a customer
bad_output: There was a billing error. It's fixed now.
reason_why_bad: No details about what the error was, no apology, no specifics about the correction, no refund mention, too terse
